channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Yet another flytipper, 19th November
item.description:
Despite other items just being cleared someone has now dumped more items on this corner as they clear out a flat. This corner and the one opposite are CONSISTENT FLY TIPPING HOT SPOTS THAT REQUIRE SIGNAGE AND/OR CCTV. How many times do we have to ask!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunsmure Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree and its support bent Sheep Ln, 19th November
item.description:
The tree and its support on pavement on Sheep Lane seems to have bent slightly sideways. Not sure if it was wind or something else that caused it. Not quite low hanging branches but couldn't find a better category.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sheep Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A2018 / A2 roundabout double arm street light at top of entry exit ramps are not working, 19th November
item.description:
A2018 / A2 roundabout double arm street light at top of entry exit ramps are not working. What 3 words locations: ///cake.about.voting & ///count.closes.dared are not on a night and ///spun.tame.panels has only 1 lamp working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Joydens Wood, Dartford

item.title: Mattress dumped, 19th November
item.description:
Mattress dumped on pavement. Reported multiple times but you keep saying you cannot see it. Its 100 yards from the traffic lights on sevenoaks way outside homebase and grays farm school. Almost opposite the old entrance to homebase. It needs to be sorted. How your contractors can miss it is ridiculous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Street lighting out for months, 19th November
item.description:
The streetlights on Molesworth street do not work in the early dark morning's or the evening's. I have reported this issue to TFL several times over the last 3 months as Lewisham Council have said they are not responsible for the issue, TFL is. TFL have said that they are not responsible for it. This is absolutely ridiculous. I have reported this issue several times to TFL and Lewisham Council and nothing has been done. Walking up and down that road has become frightening and anxiety inducing. Please can you help? There seems to be around 6-7 lights out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Molesworth Street, Ladywell, Lewisham, London Borough of Lewisham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage blocked on Perry Street, lots of flooding, 19th November
item.description:
On Perry Street, there is a large amount of flooding that has been reappearing for a long while now every time it rains. It’s been present for more than three months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, Crayford, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
